website_summaries.verdict: On the pricier end of the spectrum, this 2-in-1 product features an excellent modem but less-than-stellar Wi-Fi.
pros: Easy to use and feature-rich (USB port, eight downstream channels, in-house Genie app, Wi-Fi, and more)
cons: Free phone support is limited to 90 days
Not compatible with Verizon, AT&T, or CenturyLink

customer_reviews.title: Worst Experience
customer_reviews.text: This review is done after almost 2 years of using the product. The product was at fault within 6 months of usage and the technical team replaced me the device. Again within 9 months the wifi signal is very low and am getting slow internet speed. When I contacted the customer care, they told me I have to pay $99 for their technical service for an year. I can easily buy a new router. This is not customer service. 2 Products are getting into fault within an year, and we have to pay for customer service, seriously Netgear, didn't expect from an Big organization. Please do not buy netgear, There are many other options available.
customer_reviews.author: Praveen B

customer_reviews.title: Buy new
customer_reviews.text: This modem is working fantastic. Earlier, I bought a used one, and it was 2 years old I did not know this until I went to submit the warranty. I had problems with it from the get go. If you’re going to buy one buy a new one. 7 month’s later I am having issues with connections. Netgear only supports this for only 90 days. Doesn’t matter if you spend a lot or a little. Very disappointed. I don’t have the money to buy another one. I would recommend don’t go with Netgear. Research, Research, Research before you buy! I thought I did. If you buy from Amazon their warranty is only good for the same amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Lasted barely over 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router on January 18, 2019. It's been fine for about a year. However, back in March of 2020, my wifi signal started dropping. It got to the point by April that it was dropping a couple of times every single day and required rebooting it 2-3 times a day. My boyfriend and I have both been teleworking so this became unacceptable when signal drops in the middle of a meeting on several occasions. After replacing it with a new router about a month ago, we have had flawless connection since. Shame that these routers aren't built to be reliable longer than about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffy

customer_reviews.title: Parental Controls are useless!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap. Paid extra to get the parental controls and after being on with tech support 2 times for 45 minutes each time, I was finally told that this only stops your children from being on http. It does ABSOLUTELY nothing for https which is what everything is on now! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY IF YOU ARE BUYING FOR PARENTAL CONTROLS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: carolf

customer_reviews.title: Works with xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Bought for xfinity so I didn’t have to rent their equipment. It was basically “plug and play”. Took it to my xfinity store, they entered some info, I plugged it in at home and it works great. No extra steps, I was surprised. Seems like a good value. Internet speed test says I’m getting about 80 MBPS - my plan is 150, though I’m not sure if the issue is this thing or xfinity. Either way, it’s more than enough for 2 people and this router says it can handle much higher than that anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Jpoe.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: While it was easy to setup it is a useless product that reboots and random times for no reason. For a gamer such as myself this is unacceptable and I am reviewing this as a DO NOT BUY! Netgear will not be getting my money in the future as they cannot produce a stable product. After looking online this is a problem with this model at least. I will be ditching it and replacing it with a more stable product. Would love to get my money back for this boat anchor! Update: Bought an Arris router and it is working flawlessly. So I am sending this flawed unit back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Still working years later
customer_reviews.text: I bought the NETGEAR N600 (8x4) WiFi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem Router back in 2013 and it's still working. The coverage is very good: I can be sitting way out in my back yard and still have signal. 3 people can all be using phones and laptops with no problem. We stream music and movies no problem. The UI of the NetGear Genie app is a bit of a joke, but does allow you some basic necessary functions like changing the channel, passwords, and to see what devices are on the network. The NETGEAR N600 (8x4) WiFi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem Router has to be re-booted once in a while, but that's about it. A good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NarchoBlaster

customer_reviews.title: No more Netgear for our household
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our home WiFi last August. It worked great for about ten months and then, just as others have stated, started dying on us. At first thought it might be over heating so we moved it to a well ventilated area to no avail. It needs a hard reset every 2-3 days. Massively annoying seeing that so much in our house is WiFi based. Due to negative reviews in general these days about Netgear quality and security, I will be switching brands.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor W

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. I replaced my Comcast provided modem/router with this Netgear modem/router. I didn't need to call Comcast to activate the product. I simply went to the Comcast activation website and within a few minutes, I gained internet access. I no longer have to pay the $10 per month equipment rental fee. The NETGEAR administrative webpage is easy to navigate and configure settings such as changing the wireless password, allowing/denying new network devices to connect, firewall rules, accessing logs, etc. Only drawback to this product is that there are only two Ethernet ports. I have many computers and therefore a few more Ethernet ports would be beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: V. Kulkarni

customer_reviews.title: Boosted internet
customer_reviews.text: I do not know if it is boosting internet or not but I have the cheapest and lowest internet plan with a provider and it works perfect. I can even watch full hd movies online without lagging. My friend uses the provider's rooter and pays three times more than me to get three times faster internet, but he has very slow connection. Honestly I am glad to use my own modem this Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Tanju

customer_reviews.title: Super easy installation, fast speeds for video
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very tech savvy but I was tired of Comcast rental fees so I decided to buy this modem/router. First of all, the instructions make it incredibly easy to install, in less than 5 minutes it was in. Also, not needing two devices (modem + separate router) for wireless internet is favorable. The speed on it is great, I've had no issues streaming videos or uploading photos. I'm a cable cutter so streaming sling and Netflix is no sweat. It's much smaller than the Comcast one I was renting, making it more pleasantly inconspicuous on my desk. I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Murray

customer_reviews.title: Took some time ... but it's working so far
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Netgear N600 to replace a rented XFinity modem/router, which should save me $14 a month. I rated the features so low because 1) it was NOT EASY TO INSTALL even with the short sheet instructions provided, 2) there was NO DIAGRAM in the paperwork to indicate what the various icons were, though they were displayed microscopically below the base and 3) NO INDICATION, wording or otherwise, that one HAD TO PUSH THE SMALL BUTTON on the back (once I pushed it in, I was able to access wifi after connecting the XFinity internet). Crossing my fingers it was all worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesotan

customer_reviews.title: veyr basic cable modem, *very* poor wireless coverage and only basic network functionality
customer_reviews.text: It works out-of-box with comcast cable, just plug-and-play. Very poor wireless coverage. Installed in house built from woods, there is no signal in the room about 10 meters from the modem... There is no concrete or metall constructions between the modem and laptop, just thin walls built of wood. Very disappointed from the modem, had to buy repeater for $30 Update: configuration interface is very poor. Basic functionality only, If you need to as use a single sip device then forget about it. You can't even see logs what is going on , not possible to perform a simple troubleshooting. Basically it is a very basic cable modem. Avoid it using as an access point or a router.
customer_reviews.author: IS

customer_reviews.title: Had it for 5 years
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 5 years now and its worked well for us. I hardwire into it for work and have had very few interruptions, and I think those were primarily the fault of Comcast. My house is 1600 sq ft and the wifi can be spotty on our devices that are on the second floor or basement. We're ready to upgrade to a Netgear Nighthawk and see if that gives us a bit more power.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Borealis

customer_reviews.title: Bought new, but was a returned registered product
customer_reviews.text: Bought brand new (supposedly not furnished), but wasn't able to register the first time when contacting Comcast, as the product was previously opened, registered, and returned. Had amazon ship out a replacement. Please do not do this. If it is advertised as new, please do not recycle and smuggle in used product. This is serious misrepresentation.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Huang

customer_reviews.title: confusing to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to extend the wifi coverage in my house and my first mistake was thinking my brother would actually help like he said he would. When I got tired of waiting, I tried to do it myself and realized that this modem doesn't have the correct plugs for home phone and internet modem capabilities. Now I can't return it and no one knows how I can make it work! this isn't easy to install for a non techie like me.
customer_reviews.author: BakerMom29

customer_reviews.title: Didn't break down over 2 years but TERRIBLE 5GHz band
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in 2016 and it has been working ever since. Cable connection is good and ethernet very stable. But the router's 5GHz band will stop frequently for no reason, while 2.4GHz still working well. It has to be solved by logging into control panel and resetting the 5GHz band or the router itself. Very disappointed about this since 5GHz is the only fast wifi channel I want to use at home. Also the signal range is very limited, weaker than a wifi extender: my router is on the 1st floor but signal is terrible on the 2nd floor and in basement (about 6-10 feet away up and down).
customer_reviews.author: BigNeco Lover

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Bad choice! Bought this product in February. Should have known there would be issues when set up didn’t go right! Since set up our WiFi was spotty at best. Constantly dropping signal, needing to reset modem. Finally today it failed altogether. All devices connected but none able to get service! Called internet provider and everything looked great on their end. Transferred to Netgear who told me I would need to pay for them to troubleshoot because it was outside 90 days. Purchased another modem/router at local store and was up and running within 15 minutes! Missed a 1/2 day of work over this and now I can’t even return this crappy product. Don’t buy-not worth the hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable trash
customer_reviews.text: This worked as advertised for about 7 or 8 months tops. After that we started intermittently getting the exclamation point saying internet may not he available even with full Wi-Fi bars. We are now at the 1 year point and the device has stopped working all together. 100% non functional. I am furious with netgear as I went through the trouble to register the product in hope of some kind of support. Nope, all warranty shows expired. This whole thing where companies are cranking out Chinese garbage intended to last for mere months is an epidemic. Take your hard earned dollars elsewhere for the love of God.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Q

customer_reviews.title: No tech help unless you pay $$$$$$
customer_reviews.text: Used with Comcast. WiFi continually cut out. Cable and computers in different rooms so only WiFi as option. First machine was defective and got replacement. 2nd modus/router is as bad. I used my one time tech support when 1st router was not working. Want to charge $60-120 for continuous tech support. Going back to leasing router from Comcast. Worth $10/mo
customer_reviews.author: marijpaul

customer_reviews.title: A lot of features.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ease to connect and be online. I have several products in my home besides computers which use the router, such as my home security cameras. They work on the 2.4 ghz while most everything else is on the 5ghz channel. Every device connects and works fine with this router. High speed Internet helps for sure. It has durability as a feature to rate, but it’s not a football, so hopefully it can take just sitting on a cabinet for several years.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Works until it doesn’t.... be aware.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem/router in July 2018 and a few months later I started having issues with it. Sporadically the WiFi will cut out and demand I restart the device in order to reboot and connect to WiFi. After checking with my internet provider that it wasn’t a connectivity issue on their end, I succumbed to restarting the modem/router as needed to reconnect to WiFi. This was the “trick” for some time, but now it just simply fails to connect to the internet. Unfortunately it’s past the return timeline (30 days) and I’m simply left with faulty device.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara J.

customer_reviews.title: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly - Saved net $1 per month
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Easy setup in 5 minutes. Saves me $13/mo. Xfinity router rental. (but... read on) The Bad: Shorter range / weaker signal compared to my old Xfinity router. Poor signal on the deck and in the backyard. (Never a problem with my old Xfinity router.) The Ugly: Often disconnects my iPhone Xr. Takes 45-60 seconds to reconnect. Causes my iPhone to use Xfinity mobile data so it goes over the free 100 Mb monthly data. Gets charged $12/mo. per Gb. The End: So overall, I saved $1 per month. Woohoo.
customer_reviews.author: Gunpowder & Lead

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had it for very long, but so far it works fine! One note: you DO have to call your internet provider to have them register your equipment in order for it to communicate with their services. It doesn't say that on the packaging, and it makes it seem like you can kind of just plug and go as long as you've set up wifi service with a provider, but it's a slightly longer process than that. Nothing painful, but hopefully my warning will save you some time while you wait around for the lights to come on. :)
customer_reviews.author: F. Moore

customer_reviews.title: It was marginally ok for 15 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this NETGEAR C3000 modem rather than rent Verizon's standard device. Despite Netgear's good reputation, this thing never performed well; it should have been replaced immediately. Instead, 15 months and several tech issues/visits later -- and a final week of weak or no connectivity -- it simply quit.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyB

customer_reviews.title: A big headache!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in March and just had Comcast out today to hook it up. The modem/router I received was already used! The serial numbers on the box did not match the serial numbers on the modem/router that was inside the box. I would like to receive a credit for the difference between new and refurbished modem please!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: You need a coaxial cable
customer_reviews.text: Coaxial cable is not included in the packet which you will need if you are using xfinity. Otherwise it is an excellent model-router combo. This is my second purchase for the new house. I think the range is sufficient enough for a small 2bhk house. It will definitely save your money on rental routers which you eventually have to give back. I think bank for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Shashwath

customer_reviews.title: DEVICE WAS LIKELY REFURBISHED AND SOLD AS NEW.
customer_reviews.text: Device was likely refurbished and sold as new. DEFAULT PASSWORD HAD BEEN CHANGED, AS WELL AS THE SECURITY QUESTIONS. Normal factory reset did not work. Found an alternative hard reset on the Netgear community page which involved pressing hard reset for 30 seconds with the device plugged in, continued holding it for 30 seconds while unplugged, and continued holding it for 30 seconds plugged in again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!!! DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for our comcast cable TV and internet. Not even close to the outdated wireless modem/router combo we had rented from comcast. The wifi continually drops service on our phones and laptop.. Have had two techs here and we are tech savy, Our house is not big, we can barley get service when we are sitting on top of it. we cannt get a signal fto connect our 1 year old wireless printer that worked perfectly before. After weeks of trying to resolve the poor connections we are dropping it in the trash and kissing our $100 goodbye. Lesson learned. DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT! IT CANNOT BE RETURNED!
customer_reviews.author: BSA

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer
customer_reviews.text: C3000 – N300 WiFi Cable Modem Router I don't like the product because netgear customer support is greedy Purchased in September, 2014, this netgear gateway is now unreliable: despite a strong signal it won't allow connection and requires a power cycle to get it up and running again. My tenants cannot count on the normally strong and reliable high speed wifi connection unless I'm home and can power cycle it. In 2015 after the warranty ran out, it was hacked. When I called netgear support for help, they charged me $40 to reset the password, which given sufficient time, I could have done on my own. I don't like this company and won't buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this device.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted maybe one year. The technology is dated and inefficient unless hardwired. Do yourself a favor and buy a newer router using the latest 802.11ac standard for optimal speeds, if it supports MIMO, that's usually a good sign as well. Less about the router now, I have had each of the providers listed, they all are terrible. No notifications of network outages or planned maintenance and poor customer service. I have experience as a network administrator.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for some people but not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Awful. I spent about a week torturing myself with this router/modem. I spent hours setting up my smart home and numerous devices only to find it dropped internet about every couple of minutes. I requested a replacement thinking I had received a defective one but after doing more research I discovered this was all too common a problem that has been so, for a very long time. Netgear is aware but has not come up with a solution. I sent the replacement back without even opening it. I opted for a more expensive Motorola model which took me 5 minutes to set up and it works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mom46545

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well.
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked it up as a replacement for the Modem I was getting from Spectrum, which I thought I was paying $10 a month for. Saving money, right? Apparently, Spectrum, who recently purchased Oceanic Cable, does not charge for their modems. Also, since my landline was part of my internet package with Spectrum, I still need their Modem for the phone connection. Sigh. Even the tech at Spectrum acknowledged that this combo Modem/Router has greater range than the Spectrum Modem.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Blaz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Modem!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Modem! Yeah, it was a little expensive, but it's definitely worth it in the long run rather than renting a modem monthly from a cable provider! It's small and sleek, and it provides fast internet and WiFi. Never really had a problem with it and I've had it for almost two years so far. It's been compatible with X-Finity by Comcast as well as Time Warner cable. I especially like having our own modem because cable companies cannot adjust the speed of the internet to their liking. It seems like this is a tactic for you to buy a higher speed internet from them. Well this will not work for me. Highly recommend this modem!
customer_reviews.author: Hazy Mist

customer_reviews.title: An unfortunately slow experience
customer_reviews.text: Overall just felt slower, even when directly plugged in via ethernet. Replace with a Motorola SB6121 modem, and a TP-LINK TL-WDR4300 router, and had much better response time over 2.4Ghz, 5Ghz, and ethernet. With the Netgear, I would sit and wait for a web server's address to resolve, which made it seem like a DNS issue, but I tried using Google and OpenDNS and both were equally slow. I could not stream content reliably without waiting for it to buffer often, even though my internet package goes upwards of 105Mbps down, 20Mbps up. I was not satisfied, and am glad I switched to another setup.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Furrow

customer_reviews.title: Had a little trouble setting it up...
customer_reviews.text: Once plugged in and wires connected it set up it's own network in stead of connecting to my existing network. I just needed to connect my other wireless devices to the new network...I am 70+ I am sure others would have had less difficulty. Once set up... works perfectly and by doing the "Gateway" I got rid of a a bunch of wires and cables.
customer_reviews.author: thestone46

customer_reviews.title: SOME DO,...SOME DONT.  ......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a new cable installation. Handed it to the Comcast guy and he hooked it up. Then it was paired with my existing system and started out by working fine. However, shortly that afternoon, at random times my internet would shut down and although the modem would show activity. Comcast came back and determined their lines were fine. We discovered that unplugging the modem waiting a few seconds and plugging it back in solved the problems til the next random crash. Reading other reviews I now see that this is not a unique problem ..some modems work well, some crash. however I don't need that frustration. I returned the unit and went with a different brand
customer_reviews.author: gh

customer_reviews.title: TWC wouldnt stay connected :(
customer_reviews.text: This product started off great and connected right away to TWC. But after 2 days it started to drop the connection every 30 minutes and had to do a hard reset every single time. I called TWC but they couldnt do anything about it. I actually bought another one 4 months later to see if it was the first product i had and it did the same thing so i returned it and just a bought a nice wireless router and im not saving money on the modem rental a month, but my wife is happy so i should be happy right? haha
customer_reviews.author: Justin DePalma

customer_reviews.title: Bad Purchase. Dont Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 2 months and then suddenly it stopped working. Initially I thought its the problem from Internet Provider but after wasting 2 days it turns out that Modem is not working. Waste of time and 2 days of office work is impacted. Its not sold by Amazon so for any queries you have to contact the seller who is not responding to email or calls.
customer_reviews.author: Mayur Jadhav

customer_reviews.title: Works, but better modems for the same price range avaliable
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for over a year and recently bought one for my friend, who complained it was slow. With my internet speed staying constant, I recently switched to a different router/modem in the same price range and have gotten better results. With Xfinity 75 Mbps + Speed Blast, I was getting 7-15 Mbps download and 1-5 Mbps upload, usually on the lower end. I have tried this at two different apartments to see if there was any change, but tests stayed about the same. Additionally connection was lost periodically, giving the user an overall bad experience and not maximizing internet speed purchased. I would not recommend this product unless you did not require download speeds above 5 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Exposure to Lead Warning
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for my health and there is a warning inside the product that says you can be exposed to unsafe levels of lead by using the product. No other info on how that could happen. I tried to find info online about it but I was unsuccessful. I would not have bought it if I had that info before.
customer_reviews.author: S. PFEIFER

customer_reviews.title: Works great and it saves me money!
customer_reviews.text: I Switched internet services to Time Warner Cable and I wanted to purchase my own modem to avoid unnecessary rental fees with TWC's equipment. I must say the product works great and I have not had any issues since I have had it installed. It looks nicer than most rental modems you receive from internet providers and I liked the default password provided. Instead of a series of numbers you can never memorize, I got a whimsical password I easily memorized to avoid getting on my knees to look up passwords on the bottom of the device when friends come over and ask for Wi-Fi info. I am happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: marke81

customer_reviews.title: terrible - do not waste you money
customer_reviews.text: netgear will only support for 90 days then the tell you - that you have to go in and change the setting on your own . I will not hold a wifi signal for more then an hour and then it kick you off the internet. I purchased this in july and now am forced to get a new one --- product is not reliable at all
customer_reviews.author: Renee Cole

customer_reviews.title: device refurbished as was explained by netgear tech support
customer_reviews.text: serial number is covered by white plastic, tht i can't remove. for 3 months worked ok, until its not. had to call for tech support 888-netgear. 638-4327. couldn't provide serial number! covered! amazon is now not helping me, as amazon just served as a shipper. and return window was only a month. contacted DealRHere. wish never bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself the hassle and don't buy this wireless modem ...
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the hassle and don't buy this wireless modem. Connection drops repeatedly. I tried working with Netgear and Time Warner Cable for three months to resolve the issue. I have another wireless router that works now but Netgear won't allow me to return it for a refund as "they don't have a process for that" and I can't return it through Amazon because it's 30 days past the time of purchase. It took three months, multiple contacts to Netgear and three visits from TWC to figure out it was the wireless router. Netgear won't even help me now unless I pay for technical support with them since it's been three months. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to work with Time Warner Cable. Like: Works with Time Warner Cable The idea of it - an all in 1 device, save space, wires and of course $ :) Don't Like: Well the actual device. The internet would drop out at least once a day and that's within the first week of buying it. Simple math, if you stream videos or anything remotely heavier than email and basic browsing, this won't do it. It's incapable of handling heavy use on a consistent basis which means occasional internet disconnections which will only get worst with time. We returned it, and went with a combo of a standalone modem and router (links below) and they've been awesome so far:
customer_reviews.author: Jeans&Jets

customer_reviews.title: This router is a headache
customer_reviews.text: For $97, you would expect that this thing would be hassle-free. I bought this router because I was tired of renting one through Xfinity, and this thing keeps disconnecting me from WiFi when I'm playing online games. I've had nothing but problems with this router which requires more troubleshooting than I'd like. I've had mine for less than a year and I would not recommend this model at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica G.

customer_reviews.title: Time Warner customers beware.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this works fine and the issue is Time Warner Cable, however I've always had crappy video streaming experiences and even though I should be getting speeds of up to 50 with my plan I routinely got let than 10 and sometimes less than 1. Most of the time when it streamed was pixelated and buffered all the time. When I contacted TWC, they blamed the router, said I should have gotten one with 5GHz band. I advise anyone with TWC to look around for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Absolute rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this product. I have never been so disappointed with an Amazon purchase. Basically, it never worked properly the modem was fine and fast but the actual wifi router slows down your connectivity to 40Mbps and that was while next to the machine.!!! You waste money on a good connection because this device is terrible and doesn't support even minimal speeds. Look for a different one, it says it supports speeds of 300mbps IT DOES NOT. By the time I realized it was not comcast's fault it was too late to return this lemon. I have nothing kind to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: sch_97202

customer_reviews.title: I have intermittent internet which is no good for me
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if there is a firmware problem with this model or not but I can't rely on this model. After losing internet several times, the technician at Spectrum suggested that the firmware version I had was not current. The Netgear website says that I cannot update the firmware myself and that I need to contact my ISP to do it. I called Spectrum back and they said that they can't do it and that I needed to call Netgear. I called Netgear and they said that they cannot update the firmware. So where does that leave the customer? I have intermittent internet which is no good for me. And I have no solution to my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Wright

customer_reviews.title: Don't rent the Router, Own this instead
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review after using this router for more than a year. I am using this router in 2 bed rooms apartment. Getting good connection and good speed seamlessly in both rooms. BUT Not as good as when you connect with modem. I have used it on Xfinity and Spectrum network. Using this to connect more than 6 devices. All are working great. I feel it is better to own this router rather paying monthly fees to rent from provider. Cons: Giving 4 star because of sometimes connection drop and required reboot, every month at least one time.
customer_reviews.author: Ishita

customer_reviews.title: Getting  installation help was a major problem
customer_reviews.text: The basic product is a bit unreliable at times. However, gearing it installed is very difficult because Amazon Echo support doesn't know how to do it and the average TP Link Support tech does'n 't know either. I called TP Link back several times until I ran int a tech named Juan, he knew what to do and I am up and running. Good Luck! p Link
customer_reviews.author: Hal R

customer_reviews.title: Decent but lasted only 15 months, no support from Netgear.
customer_reviews.text: This modem/router worked adequately for 15 months. The range was not amazing but it did the job. The modem part of this item stopped working, making it unusable. Netgear only offers support for 90 days after purchasing the item (unless you want to sign up for "premium support" (starting at $49.99). I now have to buy a new modem/router and it will not be a Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Colen

customer_reviews.title: BAM!
customer_reviews.text: There it is, 300mps, right out of the box, fastest setup in the history of setting up modems with Time Warner (I was off the phone in under 5 minutes) and, wow, fast! It produces fast, and very stable, speeds, and I moved after buying it, the second setup was so fast the cable guy thought something was wrong, it was funny. I also like the dim lights, now it can go in my living room instead of a back bedroom because of the light pollution some give off. Highly recommend for Time Warner, cannot vouch for any other cable system.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck M.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I was renting a modem/router from xfinity and I returned it for this modem/router, it saves me $10 every month so it pays for itself in less than a year. I get faster internet speed through both a direct cable connection and wifi compared to the modem/router provided by xfinity. My wifi signal also reaches a bit further. The interface is nice and easy to understand and the instructions are very clear as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric_S

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Speed and DOES NOT WORK AS NETGEAR CLAIMS
customer_reviews.text: The good part: None. The bad part: Everything. ISP: Comcast/Xfinity Expected speed: 60 Mbps Current speed: 18-20 Mbps Comcast says, no issues from their end, Netgear said the same. Bad customer service from Netgear: Contacted Netgear support but does not work the steps they suggested. About to close the Comcast account and raise a complaint with the help of FCC against Comcast and Netgear. Stuck in the middle of nowhere, so PLEASE DONT BUY THIS ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: Viraj

customer_reviews.title: Was Meh Until It Wasn't...
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked well enough (I was paying for 50Mbps download speeds but maxing out at 15Mbps) for about 1 year. The last two weeks, my download AND upload speed dropped as low as 1.5Mbps. Even after my Xfinity/Comcast technician came out, completely rewired my condo and the floor I live on, the download and upload speeds maxed out at 5Mbps. Technician suggested it might be this modem/router. I went to Xfinity and rented their unit just to test the theory and they were right. Maxing out wireless download and upload speeds around 50-60Mbps. tl;dr: This unit was sub-par for a year and then died. Tried to save money on renting Xfinity equipment and now am in the hole $80+.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support
customer_reviews.text: NetGear will not release firmware upgrades to customers who buy cable modems. They have this insane idea that it is the ISP provider who needs to upgrade the modem, which is stupid when it is the customer who owns the modem. I need to replace my NetGear C3700 modem because the signal is dropping out. The firmware is out of date but NetGear does not have it available for purchasers of their modems. I am going to replace my modem, but I will never purchase another NetGear product.
customer_reviews.author: mountain man

customer_reviews.title: A REAL BAD DEAL
customer_reviews.text: Worst experience ever. Item did not work, wouldn't hook up. I called NETGEAR support six times. Wait time was 45-60 minutes each time. Twice they said cannot hear you, disconnect and would hang up. Their English was terrible and they were Asian from God's knows where. They were terrible and I unplugged as per their request. On what of the calls they wanted me to reset and stick paper clip in the hole on front panel. There was no pin hole on the frt. panel. I would recommend that you find a different brand, nd check out their call center and be sure you can communicate with them. I sent the unit back.
customer_reviews.author: Donald G. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Say Good-Bye to your Cable Modem rental fee!!
customer_reviews.text: Say Good-Bye to your cable modem rental fee! This is a great deal and a a great modem for streaming content. It is not the highest speed by far that is available, but for the price you are getting a quality product. You pay $10 or more a month to your ISP for their modem this literally pays for itself. I have two xbox ones, two laptops, two ipads, two phones and a fire stick, apple tv and I can run them all at the same time. It's crazy and its a good deal. If you are on a budget and need a good modem. Look no further! It arrived on time and works as described, another great Netgear product!
customer_reviews.author: Freedom2

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless cable modem
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless cable modem. You may need to call your cable provider first - I did with COX, and the service people took the info they needed, I plugged or screwed things where they needed to go, and I was up and running on my laptop quickly. The other wireless things needed to be 'connected', and then I was done. Be sure to use a password so that other people don't piggy-back on your connection, which will slow your speed down, and could get you in trouble if they are hacking using your connection. Be safe(r), use a password. Use a big, ugly password (numbers, upper and lower case letters), and not something they'd be able to guess.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Start to have disconnection problems from time to time AFTER 1 year!
customer_reviews.text: This device started to have connection issues now after I purchased it for 1 year. I use Comcast service in San Jose, CA and their connection is always good. Comcast reset on their end when the connection issue coming up couple times, but it still keeps happening. I agree with other reviews about the life of the product. It can still connect to the wifi, but it disconnects from time to time. First it broke down once a week, now it needs to be reset(turn the power off and then on) once a day. It is not good experience if you have strong demand on wifi. The connection becomes VERY UNSTABLE after one year!
customer_reviews.author: Tianyu Zhao

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This modem is great! The WiFi signal is good and all the information you need to set it up is on the bottom....it took me a while to figure that out as I know nothing about setting up internet and cable. I have Xfinity and it was super easy to set up on the modem’s end.....Xfinity not so much. But it works now and I am happy :D
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Weak wifi
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Black Friday, and and was excited to lower my Comcast bill. However, this product has a weak wifi signal, even from 2 ft away. With my phone on top of the modem I get 80 - 100mbps, 2-5 ft away it drops drastically to around 25mbps. Forget about good connectivity in another room. I'm now buying a router to get a better signal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy currently, I've been putting up with it for ...
customer_reviews.text: I hardly get signal in the far room of my home which is about 25 feet from the modem. Not very happy currently, I've been putting up with it for a month now. I will be contacting Netgear to see if they can help me trouble shoot this problem. My tv and phone work fine in the living room where the modem is set up so its got to be a signal issue. I will write an updated review after I contact Netgear
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Two up, two down! </Vin Scully voice>
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am 0 for 2 on this thing. I changed the admin password, and was then unable to log in. (Yes, I wrote it down!) On the first box, the reset switch jammed. Netgear (who's web support was very good) said send it back. Which I did. I reset the password on the new one, and could not log in. Again. (Yes, I wrote it down!) The reset switch was jammed, so again I could not reset it to the default settings. I plane on returning it for a different (and hopefully, more reliable) model, once things around Casa Chaos settle out a bit. Two stars because support was so good. One for the device. Maybe.
customer_reviews.author: leelu

customer_reviews.title: Great modem, not so good wireless router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I was tired of paying the monthly rental fee from Timewarner for a modem. As a modem, this devise works great. What I was not overly happy with was the wireless router piece. I had an Apple Airport Express prior and wanted something will alittle more range and this did not deliver. I tested this side by side with the apple express and the express had a greater distance and faster speeds. So needless to say I turned off the wireless and bought an Airport Extreme. In hind sight I should have gotten just a modem by itself and had the wireless separate, which I do now, just by disabling the wireless piece.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few weeks. Then it just started working only intermittently. My whole office, cell phones, laptops, printer, tv, everything is experiencing total wifi unreliability. I'm shopping today for a new modem/router because I can't deal with the nuciance any more!!! The wifi signals are all strong but are not connecting to the internet at times. Also to echo another recent review, when it was working, the 5G worked great as long as you were within 15 feet of the router. Otherwise it was undetected by devices. I am not a novice user or an ignorant newbie. Total junk.
customer_reviews.author: Hostamon

customer_reviews.title: Please, read my review.
customer_reviews.text: It's working great. Unfortunately, I miss access to 5G wifi, but the unit so far has been reliable and works well with all of my devices. Setup was easy and the products ARE compatible with nearly all of the cable ISP's. Adding the Netgear Genie app made for an overall great experience and a greatly increased level of control. Again, I miss access to 5G, but I knew what I was buying and feel I found a great deal for what I paid. I'd recommend the C3000 to anyone looking for a budget centric setup, and have only praise for Netgear's products.
customer_reviews.author: Findrome

customer_reviews.title: Great even at 100 feet away with extender
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have this at my moms house because the cable company could not run my service to my camper which is 100 feet behind my moms. I am able to still get internet service but the modem connected to it for a home phone not so great. You have to sit in a certain spot and not move a muscle during the call or the person on the other end says your breaking up so bad I can't hear you. Now that is possibly due to the cable service not the router. I say signal 100 feet away for internet with a little extender thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Miss OJ Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Xfinity/Comcast wants I think $10 a month just to rent a modem. Seriously?? We bought this and have not looked back. It has almost paid for itself already in rental fees that we have not had to pay. Setup was very simple, with no issues at all connecting or dropped service. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Giantsfan510

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the bad reviews Have had connectivity issues from the beginning. Spoke to tech support during 3 month warranty period. They made some adjustments. Did NOT help. Spoke to someone after 3 month period. Wouldn't talk to me unless I bought a new warranty. Cheapest warranty would be within $20.00 of new Modem. I am having to reset the Router about once every 24 hours. Have other items that require re-booting when this occurs. Range is very limited also. This is definitely not a good product. I have had other Netgear products with reasonable success. Save yourself a lot of grief. DO NOT buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Harold Blain

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for most activities.
customer_reviews.text: Although I only had the equipment for a short period of time. It does what it should do most of the times. For anyone unfamiliar, if you need additional speed this will not help the speed that is on your Internet Service Provider side. This equipment just helps you get a certain amount of bandwidth at a certain speed if the environment is right and is directly hardwired plugged in. keep this tip in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router after having issues with the router provided by my cable company. I was able to save $5 a month for the wifi router. (Which they never tell you that your paying for). And I saved headaches because I would have to wait for a new router in the mail every time their router stopped working. The only problem left is my cable provider.
customer_reviews.author: A Mc

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre long term reliability
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Time Warner Cable customer in Austin, TX. Pro: It works okay. I get my advertised speeds, however, sometimes I experienced hiccups in loading pages. Streaming videos worked fine, but loading new webpages seemed to take a little longer. Cons: I've gone through two of these modems in the last 3 years. My first failure occurred within a year of owning. I replaced it through RMA warranty from Netgear. It took about 10 days to replace. The first symptoms were the ethernet ports failing and spotty WiFi. My replacement has recently bit the dust, dying suddenly in the middle of streaming YouTube videos. I'm hesitant to purchase a replacement given the mediocre long term reliability of the modem.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very good modem/router with a decent WiFi section
customer_reviews.text: The C3000 comes as reasonably cost-effective all-in-one home gateway for cable connection. It is approved by many provider and can be installed very easily. I am currently using it with Xfinity service and it has no problem delivering 100+Mb/s in download when connected with a wire to a computer. The activation was painless, and as soon as connected and turned on for the first time, it proceeded to update its own firmware and reboot a couple of times in the process. The WiFi is its weak spot: the range is not a problem for me, but download seems to top at 35Mb/s, still good but not so much compared to the bandwidth available on wired.
customer_reviews.author: bakedbread

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money - it totally bottlenecks!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this product for 5 months and it is no good to us anymore. Our internet speed is up to 300MPS and it bottlenecks at this router. We originally purchased for streaming TV and it worked for a few months. Now we can only get about 8MPS to our TV from our computer where speed is lightning fast. Wasted $100
customer_reviews.author: Erin M

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I had an Xfinity cable modem and changed to the Netgear cable modem/router and am extatic about it. I was skeptical using a 3rd party and setting it up but it is so easy to set up. It will pay for itself within 6 months and I’m not paying Comcast for a stupid rental fee anymore. This product is better “signal wise” than the Xfinity modem and I couldn’t be happier. Thank you Netgear
customer_reviews.author: Gerbz17

customer_reviews.title: So great, I'm buying again after lightning fried the first one
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT modem. I'm coming back to update my review. My house recently got hit by lightning. I had originally purchased this to avoid the costly monthly rental fees thinking I would have it for years to come. Well, 10 months later it was fried with the 1 million volts that coursed through my coax cable. But, I liked it so much and it worked so flawlessly that I am purchasing again. Great product, highly recommend! Friendly Reminder: Use your surge protector's coax cable filter... it would have saved my modem and my separate router that got fried through the Ethernet connection.
customer_reviews.author: FPow

customer_reviews.title: Too slow!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it about 5 years so far. Around 3 months ago, I upgraded internet speed to 100 mbp from 25 mbp. The speed has been very slow. For download speed, desktop which directly connects to this router is ~19 mbp, wifi is 3 - 5 mbp. Xfinity customer service said probably is router's problem. Don't why? Any idea?
customer_reviews.author: Penny Yang

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy/ignore the 4.5 star rating, read reviews!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst router. I have had it for 3 days and consistently get up to 20mbps when i have 150mpbs with Cox. Can’t play video games, can’t watch Youtube or Netflix, can’t do anything! Went over all the troubleshooting with Netgear, adjusted all the settings I could, tried everything with Cox as well and still nothing. There are several threads on Netgear’s website about this specific router having this problem (google Netgear n600 router slow speeds) and Netgear’s tech team wanting to charge you to walk you through how to fix it and it STILL doesn’t work correctly afterwards. Do not waste your money, unbelievable that $100 did not get me a half decent router.
customer_reviews.author: Rashawn McCraney

customer_reviews.title: Don not buy this modem/router
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT purchase this product!!! I bought this Modem/Router to hook up to my local cable provider whose service provided a faster internet connection than Verizon, which was awfully slow. When they connected this product the direct internet connection was fast but the wireless part of the product failed any speed test the service technician tried. It Is NO good for wireless speeds. I ended up buying the cable company modem/router which immediately met the speed tests for the cable connection.
customer_reviews.author: Deacon Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I am using it for a long time now and everything is awesome. Reliable, runs 24/7 without any problem. It is able to handle all of our 6 devices with no issue. I just recently upgraded to 100 Mbs internet and with cable it is capable to deliver that speed but the wifi does not for some reason although according to the specifications it should be. I am not sure that it is the fault of the router or there is an other factor I don't know about. Until it is solved I give only 4stars.
customer_reviews.author: Krisztian Torma

customer_reviews.title: Provides Solid WiFi at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: After moving into our new apartment, we were in desperate need of a modem and router for wifi. This thing was one of the first items we saw, and we are really happy we found it. The price is almost too good to beat for both a modem and a router. It get's the job done, works with Time Warner Cable, and was incredibly easy to setup. The only issue we've had is that it occasionally just loses the connection, but nothing that a quick restart doesn't fix. It came quickly and does a great job for our apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Great decision!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the cable company’s modem, for which they were charging me $10 a month. Should have done this years ago! Easy to hook up and no problems to report. Was compatible with all my standard PC equipment
customer_reviews.author: dmb4500

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation & Great Performance!
customer_reviews.text: I was not looking forward to purchasing and setting up a new wifi cable modem router when I changed internet providers. After researching various brands, I selected the Netgear model C3000, and set up my network wirelessly. Set up was quick, hassle-free and painless!! The instructions were clear and very easy to follow. The signal strength is excellent, and speeds matched what was promised. (The Netgear Genie App - downloadable from the web - is also a handy tool to keep track of your network and troubleshoot if needed.) I highly recommend the N300 WiFi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Model Router (C3000). Excellent performance at a great price
customer_reviews.author: BDR

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fast and stable.
customer_reviews.text: Comcast told me that my previous generation Motorola DOCSIS 3.0 modem was no longer going to be supported (why?) so I bought this one. I wan't expecting any changes in service, my Moto modem worked fine. Just to be sure I ran a test on speedtest.net right before and after installing the modem. I subscribe to their "Blast" tier which is supposed to be 150Mbps and that's about what I was getting before. With this modem I consistently get over 175Mbps, though, which is a really nice bump. Comcast's installation procedure was a pain - their self-install didn't work - I had to call them on the phone to get it to work, but since then it's been flawlessly stable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ostrom

customer_reviews.title: Free at last from fees!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to get rid of our rental fee of our old modem and to access the actual speed we were paying for. We found out our ISP gave us a modem that only reached 15 Mbps when we were paying for 30 Mbps. This modem has allowed us to use our technology without being throttled by lower speeds than what we were paying for! It has worked flawlessly since we got it, and setup was very simple! A quick call to our ISP was all it took to get the modem set for action. I highly recommend this product if you aren't afraid of commitment and buying your own modem/router!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: The latency on the router is not good. I'm not very knowledgeable on the subject, but you can find more info at bufferbloat.net. First of all, I have 75MB internet, and I do get that when using a wired connection from the N600, but with a wifi connection I get around 50-60 in the same room. Worse, the latency ranges from 100-200 ms on a wired connection, and 300-800 ms on wireless. I've used the N600 for about 30 months, and I'm not sure how long this has been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Petersheim

customer_reviews.title: This 16X modem is a bargain at $100. Rock solid performance.
customer_reviews.text: I have Charter and have always had issues with speed and bandwidth. I had the "Charter-Netgear N300 Modem - Router" (which was included at no additional fee). I wanted constant speed and bandwidth, so I bought the Netgear M500 modem, TP-LINK Archer C5 AC1200, a WD 8 port gigabit switch and Cat7 cables. I now get 60Mbps+ all day - all night - all over my house (wired and Wi-Fi). I never came close to that with the N300. I am so glad I spent the extra money and bought the Netgear M500 modem. I now realize that this 16X modem is a bargain at $100. In today's world, that's a small price to pay for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for to connect Xfinity Wifi without having to buy a separate modem and wifi router. This is both in 1 and the price is STILL cheaper if you look for it at BestBuy on black friday! :)
customer_reviews.author: Monica N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Works with MediaCom.
customer_reviews.text: Works Excellent, I have Media Ultra Plus Speed at the Moment. No problems with Service at all. This is a simple Modem, NO extras on it. This works great if you let your router do most or all the work. I use this modem, it goes to my OOMA box, and then my Asus RT-Ac68U. No problems. Lights on the ​unit not very bright so Compared to my OOMA and my Asus, it has very dim lights.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana DIY

customer_reviews.title: Died within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE! This router died within 3 months of us having it. We reached out to the seller to see about possibly getting a replacement and were told the coverage was only for 30 days (not 90), so we were out of luck. Having something die out of the blue in less than 100 days of using it is unacceptable - and a seller not willing to back the product is not worth purchasing anything from.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Got the unit in, very easy to set up. activated thru Samsung smart phone to Comcast. All systems working great, wifi with extender to back of large house. Speed test shows 28 MB thru four walls and a distance of 60 feet.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: So I thought it would be great seeing that my internet speed is only 100mbps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it's a 3.0 and should be able to handle internet speeds up to 300mbps. So I thought it would be great seeing that my internet speed is only 100mbps. Now I know that you don't get max speeds thru WiFi but you should be able to get at least half that when standing right in front it, but I could only get 22mbps, and God forbid you're in the next room then you only get 7. So that's why I returned it. Now if you plan on hooking up your device to it through an Ethernet cable then it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: mel brewerton

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money
customer_reviews.text: I've been paying rental fees for years for a (Cox) router thinking I might not get the quality in a different router. I am thoroughly satisfied with this router and could kick myself for paying for a rental all these years. You call your cable company to connect your new router to their system and off you go.
customer_reviews.author: willowcris13

customer_reviews.title: Speed Nowhere Near As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I have Cox service. My Netgear CG3000D finally gave out after all these years. I bought this to replace it. Very excited. Got it up and running, and it has HORRIBLE connectivity strength and the WORST speed I've seen on any cable connection (see attached photo). I fiddled with it for about five hours before finding a refurbished CG3000D here on Amazon for half the price. Got it today, installed it in minutes, and I have those beautiful five bars of connectivity again and the correct speed. Netgear, what is going on?! I can't recommend this modem/router combo. Keep looking!
customer_reviews.author: Mustin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the new house and couldn't be happier. It's one step better than I had in the old house, so performance is great. Works with all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Puppycaio

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi speeds
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this product to use with an internet plan that offers 60Mbps down. Installation, setup, were all good and fine as with any modem router, but I experienced slow wifi speeds. On ethernet, my laptop is pulling mid 50s Mbps as expected but over wifi my laptop was getting about 4-6Mbps. My phone was also getting about 4-6 as well on wifi. I am returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: Getting stronger WiFI signal from Netgear N600
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the Netgear N600 to replace the modem router provided by Time Warner Cable for Internet service Since I still need the TMC modem for the phone service. I need coaxial splutter and two short coaxial cables in order to connect both modems to the incoming signal source. Otherwise, the set up was uneventful. I found the WiFi signal from the Netgear N600 is considerably stronger. All my computers and mobile devices are working well with the new modem. After one weeks of satisfactory trial period I share Inform TWC to disconnect their Modem and use my Netgear N600 exclusively for my Internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nieh

product_meta.title: NETGEAR C3000-100NAS N300 (8x4) WiFi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem Router (C3000) Certified for Xfinity from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox, Cablevision & More
product_meta.description: Size:N300| Style:Cable GatewayN300 WiFi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem Router. IPv6 next generation Internet addressing support. Number of Ethernet Ports : Two (2) 10/100/1000 LAN Gigabit Ethernet ports with auto sensing technology
feature_bullets: Compatible with Xfinity from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox, CableONE & more; Double firewall protection (SPI and NAT firewall)
DOCSIS 3.0 unleashes 8x faster download speeds than DOCSIS 2.0
Note check your cable internet service provider web site for data speed tier compatibility. Ieee 802.11 b/g/n 2.4 GHz. Not compatible with cable bundled voice services
Three in one DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem + N300 WiFi Router+ 2 Gigabit Wired Switch. ELIMINTE MONTHLY CABLE MODEM RENTAL FEES Up to $156 per year
NETGEAR Genie App Content filtering Parental Controls allow you to manage your network from anywhere

specifications.Operating System: Microsoft Windows 7, Windows 8, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS or other operating systems running a TCP/IP network
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars11,086 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
